title: Angular Styling & Theming
subject: Angular
theory: Angular components encapsulate styles by default (Emulated). Special selectors like `:host` allow styling the component shell itself. Global styles (styles.css) affect everything.

examples.explanation: The :host pseudo-class selector targets elements in the component's own template.

common_mistakes.correction: ng-deep is deprecated but still used. It breaks encapsulation. Use view encapsulation modes or global styles instead.

interview_questions.question: What is ViewEncapsulation.None?
interview_questions.answer: It removes style isolation. Styles defined in this component are added to the document head and affect the global application.

summary: Angular's style system allows for modular CSS while providing escape hatches for global themes.
